poem:
The morning knocks.
I did not dream.

I could have passed
through the deepest silence,
the darkest room,
without knowing.

Instead, I wake.

The feeling arrives first,
then the light,
the breeze,
a quiet scent in the air.

The day opens without asking.
Time waits, wide and patient.

The sun will set.
Something in me rises.

I bow to the quiet,
and stay there a moment,
listening inward,
where being awake
feels enough.

It is early in the morning.
The sun holds low at the horizon.
The sky is smog and air.

Everyone seems late for somewhere.
Pedestrians carry their bags.
Cars move quickly.
Time feels small.

Along the roadside,
someone is still asleep,
untouched by the rush.

The light keeps spreading.
The world does not pause,
yet nothing asks to be explained.

For now,
this is enough.

Sitting quietly in the room alone.
I forgot to play music.

The soft sound of the television
comes from the other room.
Eyes rest on the computer screen.
The mind moves through small ideas.
Keys tap.
Then stop.

A glance at the blank wall,
as if something might appear.
The window waits.
Curtains lift and settle
with a thin current of air.

A cup cools on the floor
beside a small table.
A dumbbell nearby.
Keys and small gadgets rest where they are.

Outside, children are playing.
The moment asks for little,
only that I stay,
and let it pass.

The day does not ask you to be more.
It opens a small space and waits.

Light moves across the floor
as if practicing patience.

Somewhere, a cup warms your hands.
A breath arrives without effort.

Nothing remarkable happens â€”
and still, this is enough.

There are moments that pass quietly,
unnoticed, like a door left open.

Air moves through the room.
Time loosens its grip.

You are here, and the world
does not rush you away.

Something gentle remains.

Not every good thing announces itself.
Some arrive softly, already present.

The way stillness holds the edges of sound.
The way morning waits
before becoming busy.

You do not have to reach for this.
It is already with you.

A cup rests on the table.
It has nothing left to offer.

Hands settle in a lap,
learning the shape of stillness.

Light touches the wall,
then drifts away.
A sound fades,
leaving room behind it.

Air moves through the room,
unnoticed,
doing what it has always done.

Nothing asks to be named.
Nothing needs to stay.

A chair waits by the window.
Light gathers on its edge.

Dust moves slowly
as if remembering the air.
The room holds its breath
and then lets it go.

Nothing asks to be finished.
Nothing needs a name.
The day is already here,
settling in.

Water fills the glass
without sound.
Your fingers linger
a moment longer than needed.

Somewhere, a clock forgets itself.
The room stays still.

What matters arrives gently,
without announcement,
and stays.

The hallway is quiet.
Footsteps have passed
and left no trace.

A door rests half open.
Air moves through,
bringing nothing new,
taking nothing away.

Time loosens.
The moment holds.

Light touches the table
and moves on.
A shadow follows,
then fades.

Outside, something shifts.
Inside, nothing needs to.

You remain,
not waiting,
not rushing,
just here.

The room settles
after the door closes.

A chair remembers your weight.
The air adjusts.

Nothing follows.
Nothing waits.

For a moment,
the day holds still,
as if listening
for what comes next.

Evening arrives
without ceremony.

Light thins along the wall.
Sounds loosen their grip.

What was unfinished
rests where it is.
What mattered
does not ask again.

The day exhales.

A page stays open
longer than needed.

Words pause.
The hand does too.

Some thoughts pass through.
Others sit quietly,
content to remain unnamed.

The moment does not hurry you.
It stays.

Before sleep,
the body softens its guard.

Breath finds an easier rhythm.
The dark feels familiar.

Nothing needs to be carried forward.
Nothing needs to be held back.

Rest arrives
without instruction.

The light feels farther away
than it did earlier.

Sounds arrive
a little softened.
Movement takes its time.

Nothing asks to be completed.
Nothing insists.

The room remains,
patient,
letting the moment
be slower than planned.

The day has already been busy.
It does not need more from you.

Air moves through the space.
A surface cools beneath your hand.

Thoughts drift,
then rest.
The pause stretches
without explanation.

For now,
being here
is enough.

Something in the afternoon
loosens its grip.

Edges blur slightly.
Time widens.

What mattered earlier
can wait.
What arrives now
comes quietly.

The moment settles,
asking only
to be noticed,
and left as it is.
